definitions: showing careful attention to avoid potential danger, mistakes, or harm
characterized by careful forethought and deliberation before acting or deciding
examples: The cautious driver slowed down in the heavy rain
She took a cautious approach to investing her savings
His cautious optimism about the project proved to be wise
The committee made a cautious statement about the findings

definitions: showing a lack of proper concern or respect with an offhand or dismissive attitude
relating to or associated with horsemen or cavalry soldiers in history
examples: His cavalier attitude toward safety regulations worried his coworkers
She was upset by his cavalier dismissal of her concerns
The museum displayed cavalier uniforms from the civil war
The painting depicted cavalier soldiers on horseback

definitions: resembling a cavern in being dark, deep, and creating echoes
extremely large, spacious, and giving an impression of vast emptiness
examples: His cavernous voice echoed through the empty hallway
The cavernous mouth of the cave looked threatening
The cavernous warehouse could store thousands of containers
They entered the cavernous ballroom of the old mansion

definitions: continuing without pause or interruption in an endless or seemingly endless manner
examples: The ceaseless rain lasted for three days straight
Her ceaseless efforts finally paid off with success
The ceaseless noise from construction kept residents awake
He complained about the ceaseless demands of his job

definitions: widely known and praised for excellence or notable achievements in a field
honored or marked with festivities, ceremonies, or special recognition
examples: The celebrated author received another literary award
She became a celebrated figure in the art world
The celebrated victory brought joy to the entire nation
Their celebrated anniversary was marked with a grand party

definitions: expressing joy, triumph, or festivity to mark a special occasion or achievement
examples: The team's celebratory dinner lasted until midnight
Celebratory fireworks lit up the sky after the victory
She raised her glass in a celebratory toast
The celebratory mood filled the entire stadium

definitions: relating to the sky, outer space, or astronomical objects like stars and planets
relating to heaven or the divine realm in religious or spiritual contexts
examples: The celestial bodies were visible on the clear night
Astronomers study celestial phenomena using powerful telescopes
The painting depicted celestial beings with golden wings
She had an almost celestial beauty that captivated everyone

definitions: abstaining from marriage and sexual relations, typically for religious or personal reasons
examples: The priest took a vow to remain celibate
She chose a celibate lifestyle to focus on her spiritual growth
Many religious orders require their members to be celibate
He lived a celibate life after his wife passed away

definitions: relating to or consisting of living cells in biological organisms
having a structure of small compartments or spaces like a honeycomb
examples: The cellular structure of plants can be seen under a microscope
Scientists study cellular processes to understand disease
The cellular design of the building maximized natural light
The cellular foam material provides excellent insulation

definitions: having content removed, suppressed, or modified by authority to prevent public access
examples: The censored document had several paragraphs blacked out
The censored version of the movie removed violent scenes
His censored speech omitted all political criticism
The censored newspaper article had key names removed

definitions: relating to a hundredth anniversary or a period of one hundred years
examples: The university held centenary celebrations throughout the year
The centenary edition of the book included historical notes
They planted a tree to mark the centenary anniversary
The centenary exhibition showcased artifacts from the past century

definitions: occurring once every hundred years or relating to a hundredth anniversary
lasting for or relating to a period of one hundred years
examples: The town organized centennial festivities to mark its founding
The centennial celebration attracted visitors from around the world
The centennial oak tree was a local landmark
They published a centennial history of the institution

definitions: placed or situated in the middle or at the center of something
emotionally balanced, calm, and focused with a sense of inner stability
examples: The centered text looked better on the invitation
The sculpture was perfectly centered in the gallery
She felt more centered after her meditation session
He remained centered despite the stressful situation

definitions: concentrated in a single location or under a single authority or control system
examples: The centralised database made information access more efficient
The company adopted a centralised management structure
The centralised heating system served the entire building
Critics argued against the centralised decision-making process

definitions: concentrated in a single location or under a single authority or control system
examples: The centralized system allowed better coordination between departments
They moved to a centralized warehouse for distribution
The centralized government controlled all regional decisions
The centralized network made data management more efficient

definitions: in the process of bringing under central control or concentrating in one location
examples: The centralizing reforms consolidated power in the capital
The company is centralizing its operations to reduce costs
The centralizing tendency of the government worried local leaders
They are centralizing all customer service functions

definitions: located at or forming the middle point or main part of something
examples: The centre table held a beautiful flower arrangement
The centre position on the team requires strong leadership
The centre lane is reserved for passing vehicles
She played centre forward on the hockey team

definitions: having a specified thing as the center or primary focus of attention or activity
examples: The customer-centric approach improved satisfaction ratings
They adopted a data-centric strategy for decision making
The earth-centric model was replaced by the heliocentric model
Her child-centric teaching methods engaged young learners

definitions: moving or tending to move away from a center or axis point
examples: The centrifugal force pushed riders against the wall
The centrifugal pump moved water through the system
Centrifugal motion separated the mixture into components
The centrifugal tendency threatened to break up the alliance

definitions: holding moderate political views that are neither strongly liberal nor conservative
examples: The centrist candidate appealed to voters from both parties
Her centrist position on the issue satisfied most members
The centrist coalition formed a stable government
He maintained centrist views throughout his political career

definitions: made from clay that has been permanently hardened by heat in a kiln
examples: The ceramic vase was beautifully hand-painted
She collected ceramic tiles from different countries
The ceramic coating protected the metal from heat
They installed ceramic flooring in the kitchen

definitions: relating to grain crops such as wheat, corn, or rice used for food
examples: The cereal crops were ready for harvest in autumn
Cereal production increased due to favorable weather
The cereal aisle offered dozens of breakfast options
They studied cereal grains to improve nutritional content

definitions: relating to the cerebrum or brain in medical or anatomical contexts
intellectual and rational rather than emotional or physical in nature
examples: The cerebral cortex controls higher brain functions
She suffered a cerebral hemorrhage but recovered fully
His cerebral approach to problems impressed his colleagues
The movie was too cerebral for mainstream audiences

definitions: relating to or used for formal religious or public ceremonies and rituals
examples: The ceremonial robes were worn only for special occasions
The ceremonial sword had been passed down for generations
They performed the ceremonial dance at the festival
The ceremonial duties of the position were clearly defined

definitions: having official documentation or certification to prove qualifications or authenticity
examples: Only certificated teachers could apply for the position
The certificated gemstones came with authentication papers
She was a certificated pilot with thousands of flight hours
The certificated organic produce commanded higher prices

definitions: officially recognized as possessing certain qualifications or meeting certain standards
guaranteed to meet specified standards or requirements by an authority
examples: The certified accountant reviewed the company's finances
She became a certified yoga instructor last year
The certified organic vegetables sold quickly at the market
They only used certified materials in construction

definitions: having a deep blue color like a clear sky on a bright day
examples: The cerulean waters of the tropical lagoon sparkled
She painted the ceiling a beautiful cerulean blue
His cerulean eyes reminded her of the ocean
The cerulean dress matched the summer sky perfectly

definitions: bound, secured, or fastened with metal chains to restrict movement
connected or linked together in a sequence or series
examples: The chained prisoner could barely move in his cell
The chained gate prevented access to the property
The chained events led to an unexpected outcome
The chained reactions in chemistry fascinated the students

definitions: containing chalk or having the soft, white, powdery qualities of chalk
having a pale color and dry, powdery texture or taste
examples: The chalky soil was perfect for growing certain plants
He wrote on the blackboard with chalky fingers
The medicine left a chalky taste in her mouth
His face had a chalky pallor after the illness

definitions: having separate compartments, rooms, or hollow spaces within a structure
examples: The chambered nautilus shell showed a spiral pattern
The chambered heart pumps blood through the body
They discovered a chambered tomb in the ancient ruins
The chambered design of the building improved acoustics

definitions: capable of being changed or altered in form, nature, or appearance
frequently changing or varying in an unpredictable or inconsistent way
examples: The changeable weather required carrying both sunscreen and umbrella
The changeable design allowed for future modifications
Her changeable moods made her difficult to work with
The changeable market conditions required flexible strategies

definitions: made different from what it was before through modification or transformation
having undergone transformation or alteration in character, form, or function
examples: The changed policy affected all employees immediately
She noticed his changed attitude toward the project
The changed landscape showed effects of urban development
He was a changed man after his near-death experience

definitions: sung, spoken, or shouted rhythmically in a repetitive, often ritualistic manner
examples: The chanted prayers echoed through the temple
The crowd's chanted slogans filled the stadium
The chanted verses had been passed down for generations
Their chanted demands grew louder as the protest continued

definitions: in a state of complete disorder and confusion without any organization
examples: The chaotic scene after the earthquake shocked rescuers
Her chaotic desk made finding documents impossible
The chaotic traffic during rush hour frustrated commuters
The meeting became chaotic when everyone talked at once

definitions: having a dark gray color like that of burned wood used for drawing
examples: He wore a charcoal suit to the business meeting
The charcoal sky threatened an approaching storm
She chose charcoal curtains to match the furniture
The artist preferred charcoal tones for the portrait

definitions: able to be charged as a cost, fee, or criminal offense to someone
examples: All expenses are chargeable to the client's account
The offense was chargeable as a misdemeanor
Overtime hours are chargeable at a higher rate
The chargeable services were listed in the contract

definitions: filled with electrical energy or having an electrical charge
filled with intense emotion, tension, or excitement
formally accused of a crime or wrongdoing by legal authorities
examples: The charged battery powered the device for hours
The charged particles moved through the magnetic field
The charged atmosphere made everyone feel nervous
Their charged conversation revealed deep disagreements
The charged suspect appeared in court the next day
He was charged with theft and fraud

definitions: having a compelling charm or appeal that inspires devotion and enthusiasm in others
examples: The charismatic leader inspired thousands of followers
Her charismatic personality made her a natural teacher
The charismatic speaker held the audience's attention completely
He was too charismatic to be ignored at meetings

definitions: showing kindness and sympathy toward others, especially in judgment
relating to the assistance of those in need through organized charity
examples: Her charitable interpretation of his actions surprised everyone
He took a charitable view of their mistakes
The charitable organization helped thousands of families
They made charitable donations to several causes

definitions: delighted, fascinated, or pleased by someone or something
protected by or as if by magic or supernatural powers
examples: She was charmed by his old-fashioned manners
The charmed audience gave a standing ovation
He seemed to lead a charmed life, avoiding all danger
They believed the amulet kept them charmed against evil

definitions: pleasant, attractive, or delightful in a way that attracts and pleases others
examples: The charming cottage had roses growing around the door
His charming smile won over even his critics
She found his accent absolutely charming
The charming host made everyone feel welcome

definitions: officially licensed or authorized by a charter to operate or practice
hired for exclusive use by a particular group or for a particular purpose
examples: The chartered accountant certified the financial statements
Only chartered banks could issue certain types of loans
They took a chartered flight to the island resort
The chartered bus transported the team to the game

definitions: having a vivid yellow-green color like the liqueur of the same name
examples: The chartreuse dress stood out at the party
She painted the accent wall in chartreuse
The chartreuse sports car turned heads on the street
Spring leaves often have a chartreuse tint

definitions: abstaining from unlawful or immoral sexual intercourse
simple, unadorned, and restrained in style without unnecessary ornamentation
examples: She remained chaste until her wedding day
The monks lived chaste lives in the monastery
The chaste design of the building reflected minimalist principles
Her chaste white dress was elegantly simple

definitions: fond of talking in a friendly, informal way about unimportant things
examples: The chatty neighbor talked for hours over the fence
She became more chatty after a glass of wine
His chatty letter described all the local gossip
The chatty hairdresser kept her clients entertained

definitions: acting dishonestly or unfairly to gain an advantage, especially in a game or examination
examples: The cheating student was caught using hidden notes
His cheating behavior ruined their relationship
The cheating scandal rocked the sports world
They implemented new measures to prevent cheating

definitions: having a pattern of squares formed by crossed lines
examined, verified, or controlled to ensure accuracy or prevent problems
examples: She wore a blue and white checked shirt
The checked tablecloth gave the restaurant a casual feel
The checked baggage arrived safely at the destination
He checked the document for errors before submitting

definitions: marked with a pattern of alternating squares of different colors
marked by periods of varied fortune or discreditable incidents
examples: The checkered flag signaled the end of the race
She spread a checkered blanket for the picnic
His checkered past made him an unlikely candidate
The company had a checkered history of success and failure

definitions: showing a lack of respect or politeness in an amusing or appealing way
examples: The cheeky student made everyone laugh with his comments
Her cheeky grin showed she knew she was misbehaving
He gave a cheeky response to the serious question
The cheeky monkey stole food from tourists' bags

definitions: noticeably happy and optimistic, showing or causing good spirits and positivity
examples: Her cheerful disposition brightened everyone's day
The cheerful yellow paint made the room feel welcoming
He remained cheerful despite the difficult circumstances
The cheerful music lifted everyone's spirits
